sen.j: 益田池（ますだいけ）とは、奈良県橿原市に存在したため池で、現在は消滅している。
sen.e: Masuda-ike Pond is a reservoir which once existed in Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture but does not now exist.

sen.j: 橿原ニュータウンはその跡地に建設された。
sen.e: On the site of the pond, Kashihara New Town was constructed.

sen.j: 平安時代初期に、高取川に堤防を築いて水の流れをせき止めて作られた巨大な灌漑用の貯水池。
sen.e: This very big pond was created as an irrigation reservoir in the early Heian period by stemming the flow of the Takatori-gawa River using the embankment.
This very big pond was created as an irrigation reservoir in the early Heian period by stemming the flow of the Takatori-gawa River through the embankment.

sen.e: This very big pond was created as an irrigation reservoir in the early Heian period by stemming the flow of the Takatori-gawa River through the embankment.

sen.j: 堤防は現在の鳥屋橋北から鳥坂神社まで長さ約200メートル、高さは10メートル近くあり、満水時の貯水量は140万トンから180万トンと推測されている。
sen.e: With the embankment extending approximately 200 meters from north of present-day Toriya-bashi Bridge to Torisaka-jinja Shrine and measuring almost 10 meters in height, the reservoir is estimated to have been able to store up to 1.4 to 1.8 million tons of water.

sen.j: 現在でも堤防の一部が益田池児童公園内に残っている。
sen.e: Part of the bank still remains in the Masudaike Children's Park.

sen.j: 奈良県立橿原考古学研究所には、川底改修の際に出土した木製の樋が保存展示されており、「益田池の堤 附樋管」として奈良県の指定文化財として史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: Archaeological Institute of Kashihara, Nara Prefecture preserves and exhibits wooden gutters which were excavated during renovation of the river bed and are designated as cultural property "Gutter Pipes for the Bank of Masuda-ike Pond"by Nara Prefecture.
